Authentēs. Or A treatise of self-deniall. Wherein the necessity and excellency of it is demonstrated; with several directions for the practice of it. / By Theophilus Polwheile, M.A. sometimes of Emmanuel Colledge in Cambridge, now teacher of the Church at Teverton in Devon. Polwheile, Theophilus, d. 1689.
[48], 424, [46] p.
Printed for Thomas Johnson, and are to be sold by Richard Scott book-seller in Carlisle., London, : 1658.
The first word of the title is in Greek characters. With four final advertisement leaves. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Nouemb:". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed for Thomas Johnson, and are to be sold by Richard Scott book-seller in Carlisle., London, : 1658.
